attributes.additional_details:
According Government figures (for 2019), 3.40 million experiments were completed in GB during 2019.
Of these, 1.73 million (51%) were actual experiments on animals, which included 551,835 animals (32%) that were subjected to experiments that even the researchers considered had caused them moderate or severe suffering.
57% (984,316 experiments) were in the area of basic research – much of it driven by the curiosity of university researchers.
Only 13% of all experiments were required by regulators
attributes.background: Ban all forms of animal testing. Currently 13% of animal testing carried out is required by regulators. Today we have enough historic research and data to make further testing obsolete. 32% of animals used are subjected to tests that even researchers say causes severe side affects and trauma.
